tweets.html:
Mark Consuelos does not get enough dap.

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) July 28, 2012

Today's "Oh, crap, I'm old" realization: The Bartman is roughly 3 years older than high school seniors who just graduated.

— Bryan (@flyinglobster) July 28, 2012

Love the roundabout way TV critics have of asking FX prez John Landgraf, "Do you think Charlies Sheen show sucks as much as we do?"

— Eric Deggans at NPR (@Deggans) July 28, 2012

Hostage negotiatiation? MT @TVGuide: If #FX picks up the next 90 eps of #AngerManagement, Martin Sheen will join as series regular #TCAS12

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) July 28, 2012

See what happens when you cast Sam Waterston on the Newsroom instead of Martin Sheen, Aaron Sorkin? He ends up on Anger Management. THANKS.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 28, 2012

If #TCAs12 ended with reporters playing 'The Choice' w/ network presidents, I would turn around for John Landgraf

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) July 28, 2012

Martin Sheen on ANGER MANAGEMENT is the most disappointing casting news since Charlie Sheen on ANGER MANAGEMENT. #butfordifferentreasons.

— Joanna Robinson (@jowrotethis) July 28, 2012

Martin Sheen doing a few episodes of #AngerManagement makes perfect sense. Martin Sheen joining #AngerManagement as a regular is baffling.

— Wes Ambrecht (@iamwesley) July 28, 2012

Charlie Sheen, put away your legs. They are gross. #FX #TCAs12

— Jenna Mullins (@JBomb11) July 28, 2012

First, Charlie Sheen in plaid shorts and now Russell Brand speaks to us barefoot. Wonder if FX comics actually respect us critics. #TCAs12

— Eric Deggans at NPR (@Deggans) July 28, 2012

The second season of BRAND X will be a game changer. It will change the game of "throw the TV out the window without killing anyone."

— Julie Klausner (@julieklausner) July 28, 2012

Russell Brand thinks we should remember Daniel Tosh and Dane Cook are comedians. I will when they will. #TCAs12

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) July 28, 2012

tweets.author_name: Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There
tweets.html:
Spending the weekend alone w/ my 2yo son is quickly turning into a Lucille/Buster scene from ARRESTED DEVELOPMENT.

— Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There (@AmandaAnnKlein) July 28, 2012

A grandson, looking for his Gangee - pic.twitter.com/NomXJtgA

— Jason Bateman (@batemanjason) July 28, 2012

I hope BREAKING BAD ends with everyone getting a new kitten.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 28, 2012

Just found the exact point in the second season of The West Wing where Sorkin started rummaging through old SportsNight scripts.

— Coleman Collins (@COLEMANICEWATER) July 28, 2012

Everybody kept talking about "that paintball episode" so I watched it. I'm glad you never shut up about it. #MyCommunityStart

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) July 28, 2012

Now I ain't saying she a gold digger! But she ain't messing with no broke (looks around party warily)

— Patrick Walsh (@thepatrickwalsh) July 28, 2012

.@David_Boreanaz That the feeling you get when you tweet and thousands of people correct you is exactly what it's like to be a tv writer.

— Hart Hanson (@HartHanson) July 29, 2012

YES. OK.

The opening ceremonies WERE weird. And that's why you, Internet, of all people, should LIKE them.

— John Hodgman (@hodgman) July 28, 2012

Can we please Auto-Tune all future Michael Phelps interviews? We need SOMETHING to make them less soul-crushing. #Olympics

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 28, 2012

Still so charmed by Mary Poppins, Mr. Bean, and William Blake at #Olympics, I need a bracing dip in the muck with @sutterink and SOA #tcas12

— kentucker (@kentucker) July 28, 2012

"Kazakhstan won the gold in cycling? VERY NIIIIIICE!" - Everyone, probably

— Eli Braden (@EliBraden) July 28, 2012

Just one thing to say to the millions of Americans bewildered by Danny Boyle's 2012 Opening Ceremony. Six series of Lost. I think we're even

— tom jamieson (@jamiesont) July 28, 2012

Olympics on NBC: The History Channel

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) July 28, 2012

The real star of the games has one eye and 3 fingers .. And the kids go mad for him .. What a place the Olympic Park is ..

— Tom Edwards (@BBCTomEdwards) July 28, 2012

Let me give you a spoiler. For the next two weeks Twitter will be nothing but complaining about Olympic spoilers and tape delay.

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) July 28, 2012

This isn't just the first social Olympics; it's the first Olympics where we can see in real time the dysfunction of the broadcast monopoly

— Michael Roston (@michaelroston) July 28, 2012

Pretty sure the #Olympics are just another excuse to make "NBC sucks" jokes. Not that I'm complaining...

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) July 28, 2012

Is all of America complaining about NBC's mishandling of their Olympic coverage or just the entirety of my Twitter feed?

— the TV Addict (@theTVaddict) July 28, 2012

Pretty obvious NBC only considers Olympics entertainment & not news/sports programming. They don't understand the need for live. Bozos.

— Mike Harrington (@ByMHarrington) July 28, 2012

“And the Americans never looked back.” In rowing, the whole team is continuously looking back. #NBCcommentary

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) July 28, 2012

NBC's Olympic coverage is so bad future anthropologists will assume our TV networks used the Brave New World class system w/NBC aimed lowest

— Devan Joneson (@djoneson) July 28, 2012

What is the cheat code to make these female beach volleyball players topless? #Olympics

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) July 28, 2012

There's a women's VB player named Destiny Hooker. I'm tweeting this, of course, because she's a solid right side hitter to keep an eye on.

— Dan Clyne (@danCLYNE) July 28, 2012

The #Olympics have been on for less than 24 hours in the US but we've already medaled (gold!) in "Bitching About NBC." #nbcfail

— Kristen (@Kpengell) July 28, 2012

tweets.author_name: d o t s m y
tweets.html:
Just catching up with the men's gymnastics from earlier *adjusts self, closes blinds*

— d o t s m y (@dotsmy) July 28, 2012

Finally watched the Nashville pilot so now I'm prepared to start my "stalk Connie Britton" campaign. (You know, in a friendly way.)

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 28, 2012

Coming this fall on NBC: all your favorite prime time shows, PLUS scene-by-scene spoilers on the 6 p.m. news before each episode premieres!

— Adam Proteau (@Proteautype) July 28, 2012

NOW I get the on-screen #ICYMI hashtag during @NBCOlympics prime time coverage! #NBCfail

— Mark Joyella (@standupkid) July 28, 2012

I wish the women's volleyball uniforms were available as pajamas. They look like the most comfortable things for sleeping in.

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) July 28, 2012

Any Emmy NBC has won for anything should be revoked for this Olympics coverage.

— Matt Quirion (@mquirion) July 28, 2012

Tape delay events rest of the world watches live? Check! Website info? Limited! Hire Seacrest. Done! It's show time, boys!"- NBC

— Danny Zuker (@DannyZuker) July 28, 2012

Is tape delay worse or are we just hearing about it more because of the Twitter-Industrial-Complaint Complex? Tim Berners-Lee's revenge?

— Jonathan Wald (@jonathanwald) July 28, 2012

It's bad enough to wait hours to watch Olympic events on TV, but I have to wait two years to find out what Will McAvoy thinks!

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 29, 2012

And the medal for most Olympic whining goes to everyone complaining about what happens every four years, tape delay.

— Jonathan Wald (@jonathanwald) July 29, 2012

NBC seems to have gotten J.K. Simmons to play the part of Al Trautwig for this #olympics

— Jason Mittell (@jmittell) July 29, 2012

Television can no longer be a venue of simulcasting. It should be, as it always has been, a device of narration. It tells stories, not news.

— Linda H (@bookdal) July 29, 2012

I don't know what happened in this beach volleyball match! #newtome #brightsiding

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 29, 2012

USA Men's Basketball just won the gold medal. Tune in to NBC October 15 for the telecast, right after an all new "Smash"

— Jack Burditt (@jackburditt) July 29, 2012

NBC did not bid for the Olympics to show the games to us. NBC bid for the Olympics to show McDonalds, Visa, P&G, etc to us

— Megan McCarthy (@Megan) July 29, 2012

A sitcom about 2 women's beach volleyball players who are both teammates & roommates. There's a low-rated, critical gem for you, NBC.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 29, 2012

"Independent Olympic Athletes" is an ABC series about a team of rogue athletes who join together, are nomads, and compete in the Olympics.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 29, 2012

CBS, you get "Swimming: USA," a procedural about making the Olympic swim team in the US.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 29, 2012

And Fox, you get "American Track Stars" a Seth MacFarlane animated comedy, about track stars who make pop culture references I guess?

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 29, 2012

Admission- I watched the MMT/KWJ volleyball match on my laptop earlier to see who won. I'm watching it on NBC now to see Kerri's legs in HD.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 29, 2012

You guys. Ryan Lochte's closet. You guys. #Olympics

— Wes Ambrecht (@iamwesley) July 29, 2012

This Ryan Lochte story is not making me like him more. But the workout montage isn't terrible. #Olympics

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 29, 2012

I missed the window where it was funny to point out the possible double meaning of "XXX Olympics," didn't I?

— Keith Phipps (@kphipps3000) July 29, 2012

RT @MiaFarrow: RT @texasinafrica: Good lord. NBC nightly news is reporting that Lochte beat Phelps. AND THEY HAVEN'T SHOWN IT YET. #nbcfail

— Rachel Sklar ❄️ (@rachelsklar) July 29, 2012

WHEN YOU'VE LOST MIA FARROW, YOU'VE LOST AMERICA

— Rachel Sklar ❄️ (@rachelsklar) July 29, 2012

Ummm....the men's gymnasts are pretty hot this year. #shallowOlympics

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 29, 2012

FACT: Every male gymnast in London could pop your head like a grape.

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) July 29, 2012

Michael Phelps's reward after 8 years of being on top of the world is an exclusive interview with...Ryan Seacrest!?

— Orrin Konheim (@okonh0wp) July 29, 2012

Ryan Seacrest needs higher chair on NBC #Olympics set. W/ hands on desk, he looks like a kid or on a Weekend Update bit

— Phil Rosenthal (@phil_rosenthal) July 29, 2012

If NBC really wants to take advantage of time delaying the events, Michael Phelps will medal in this race...

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 29, 2012

Spectacular thunderstorm tonight. I get to watch it live, and I don't even have cable!

— Matt Quirion (@mquirion) July 29, 2012

Ratings will be high, but I understand that Stockholm Syndrome sufferers give their captors high marks too. #nbcfail #olympics

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) July 29, 2012

This #NBC swimming pre-race analysis is like watching old @JoeNBC episodes on TiVo after a primary.

— Micheline Maynard (@MickiMaynard) July 29, 2012

You can see from Phelps' face, he's thinking about getting 4th.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 29, 2012

Michael Phelps interview: "You didn't win. How does it feel to not win in that you didn't win and are not in the winning position? Loser."

— John Dickerson (@jdickerson) July 29, 2012

NBC has heard your distaste for Seacrest's role in the Olympic coverage, and they are working diligently to replace him with Leo from Smash.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) July 29, 2012

NBC time-delay coverage is like the airlines: its interest is in giving you the least satisfactory service you will still come back for.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 29, 2012

But the bright side of the tape-delay complaints: we will have the healing national conversation about spoilers this country has ached for

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 29, 2012

I give the contempt NBC has for its audience's intelligence a red score. #olympics #gymnastics

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) July 29, 2012

Michael Phelps has been officially demoted to endorsing the Subway Seafood Sensation footlong.

— Mark Lisanti (@marklisanti) July 29, 2012

My motto for the next two weeks? "America. Fuck Yeah." #Olympics

— Wes Ambrecht (@iamwesley) July 29, 2012

@poniewozik know a critic is a critic but how about acknowledging major advance of live stream sted of airline cracks?

— Jim Bell (@jfb) July 29, 2012

Men, if you're not at least 10% gay for Ryan Lochte you're a sexual deviant.

— God (@TheTweetOfGod) July 29, 2012

Hey Ryan, make sure you point out all the people complaining about you on Social Media.

— Julie DiCaro (@JulieDiCaro) July 29, 2012

Ryan Seacrest is reading tweets from a giant TV on NBC... All that time to kill and no time for the 7/7 victims tribute?

— Chris Kringleson (@cwilk) July 29, 2012

Everything in this picture epitomizes the worst part of NBC #Olympics coverage http://t.co/w1VZtSCm

— JD Harmeyer (@jdharm) July 29, 2012

Michael Phelps didn't get a medal today because he failed to appear in the U.S. Swim Team Call Me Maybe lip dub.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 29, 2012

Venn diagram: people who don't have cable, do hang out on twitter, really care about Olympics results (or pretend to).

— Peter Kafka (@pkafka) July 29, 2012

If you need to swim from 1 place to another, the butterfly seems like an entirely inefficient stroke. #olympics

— Tess Rodham Rafferty (@TessRafferty) July 29, 2012

The butterfly was developed by a teen boy trying to dry hump the water. #Olympics

— Tess Rodham Rafferty (@TessRafferty) July 29, 2012

Is NBC out to kill Ryan Seacrest's career through overexposure or is Seacrest out to kill NBC through empty content? Discuss

— Phil Rosenthal (@phil_rosenthal) July 29, 2012

. @jfb I haven't watched a single ad in your "curated" Olympics broadcast. And I won't. And I bet I'm not alone.

— Matt Quirion (@mquirion) July 29, 2012

@palafo @robquig for what it's worth, I've been in the non-Twitter world all day and I haven't heard one complaint about Olympics coverage.

— Brian Stelter (@brianstelter) July 29, 2012

Come on, Olympic sound engineers. I should hear a deafening “THUB” every time a gymnast blinks. Or don’t you care about realism?

— Andy Ihnatko (@Ihnatko) July 29, 2012

What bothers me most re #NBCfail is the missed opportunity. They could be on social media/web AND do the soft-core story porn in primetime.

— Brian Moritz (@bpmoritz) July 29, 2012

"You can't spell 'bongload' without 'gold'" - Michael Phelps, right before he lost

— Eli Braden (@EliBraden) July 29, 2012

Someone needs to stick the "London 2012" print logo in the microwave for 2 minutes. I don't think it's done yet.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 29, 2012

Every time there's a loud beep in the London gymnastics arena, I just assume the NBC announcers said something filthy.

— Noel Murray (@NoelMu) July 29, 2012

Watching Olympic gymnastics unlocks long repressed junior high school gym traumas.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 29, 2012

I think we have to conclude that in the end Phelps's decision to use a pool noodle might have cost him.

— John Moe (@johnmoe) July 29, 2012

My kids walked in while I was watching women's beach volleyball so I had to quickly switch over to porn.

— Mike Scully (@scullymike) July 29, 2012

"I think Michael Phelps had an awesome race." --Guy who came in 5th.

— Nell Scovell (@NellSco) July 29, 2012

A 'Chicago Fire' ad went into a shot of shirtless US swimmers staring at the camera and I honestly could not notice the switch.

— Andrew Seroff (@Aseroff) July 29, 2012

"It's 12:01 Eastern, who won the TCAs?" -People who will be reading this tweet in tomorrow's @GoodTVeets and nobody else.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) July 29, 2012

Please nobody spoil who won the swimming tonight. #London2012

— cali badger (@calibadger) July 29, 2012

A depression and a world war couldn't do it, but Seacrest's social media report has killed the Olympics.

— Danny Zuker (@DannyZuker) July 29, 2012

Coming up next, handball! It's the worst of basketball and soccer, like Ultimate Frisbee without weed!

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) July 29, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
I wonder what @MichaelPhelps thinks of #TheNewsroom? Does he hate it as much as I do?

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) July 29, 2012

NBC edited Olympics memorial of terrorism victims to air Ryan Seacrest's tribute to the deadening of our collective soul.

— Frank Conniff (@FrankConniff) July 29, 2012
